content:
• Friday, June 22, 2012
  • KEX

    Kirby (NYSE:KEX) -4.9% AH after lowering guidance for FQ3 and FY 2012. The tank barge operator...

    Kirby (NYSE:KEX) -4.9% AH after lowering guidance for FQ3 and FY 2012. The tank barge operator now sees FQ3 EPS at $0.80-$0.85 vs. prior guidance of $0.97-$1.02 and $1.00 consensus estimate, and full year at $3.45-$3.70 vs. prior $3.85-$4.05 and $3.91 consensus. The new guidance reflects deterioration in the manufacturing area and softness in oilfield-related sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 PM
  • STJ

    St. Jude Medical (STJ +2.6%) jumps at the close after a last-minute release of comments on a...

    St. Jude Medical (STJ +2.6%) jumps at the close after a last-minute release of comments on a database report suggesting a single Durata defibrillation lead was damaged by external abrasion - different from the inside-out abrasion seen previously on Riata leads. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • ARCH

    Analysts say Arch Coal's (ACI -1.9%) plans to shutter a trio of mining complexes and cut...

    Analysts say Arch Coal's (ACI -1.9%) plans to shutter a trio of mining complexes and cut production doesn't change ACI's near-term outlook. Citi's Brian Yu notes that in announcing the cuts ACI didn't change its thermal coal production guidance for the year, and says the 3M-ton reduction probably represented coal the company wasn't able to sell.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • INFO

    IHS (IHS +5.2%) says its largest stakeholder's upsized offering of 8.7M shares of its stock...

    IHS (IHS +5.2%) says its largest stakeholder's upsized offering of 8.7M shares of its stock priced at $100, a 1.8% discount to their Thursday closing price. Analysts say shares were up because the sale should improve liquidity of the stock and the sale was already factored in when it was unveiled Monday.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • CVI

    Carl Icahn to Goldman Sachs: drop dead. He says he isn't paying the $18.5M Goldman claims is...

    Carl Icahn to Goldman Sachs: drop dead. He says he isn't paying the $18.5M Goldman claims is owed by CVR Energy (CVI +1.8%) for work done earlier this year: “These guys were hired to keep me from buying the company at $30 and they failed. But they are now demanding $18M for having done nothing."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM | 11 Comments
  • SWN

    Southwestern Energy (SWN +6.6%) surges after an investor bets shares will rally over the next 18...

    Southwestern Energy (SWN +6.6%) surges after an investor bets shares will rally over the next 18 months, purchasing 3K Jan. 2014 calls for $3.75 and selling an equal number of Jan. puts for $3.20. There was barely any open interest at either strike before the trade appeared. Shares had been sitting at their lowest levels in more than three years.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • T

    Leap Wireless (LEAP +1.9%) edges higher as it begins selling the iPhone (NASDAQ:AAPL). Leap's...

    Leap Wireless (LEAP +1.9%) edges higher as it begins selling the iPhone (NASDAQ:AAPL). Leap's unique offer terms - the 16GB iPhone 4S costs $500, but comes contract-free, and plans go for just $55/month - could make it a testbed for a broader effort by Apple to sell the iPhone with a combo of low subsidies and cheap service plans. With Verizon and perhaps soon AT&T hiking service plan prices for many upgrading users, Apple has more incentive to explore alternative sales approaches.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM | 7 Comments
  • SPWR

    Some solar names are rallying after Citi's Timothy Arcuri provides another bullish note. Arcuri,...

    Some solar names are rallying after Citi's Timothy Arcuri provides another bullish note. Arcuri, who in early May suggested Euro solar demand was improving (a delayed plant closing from First Solar seems to back this up) writes today that renewable energy demand may be bottoming, even as oversupply remains a problem. U.S. demand and Japanese subsidies are seen as positive catalysts. SPWR +6.3%. GTAT +6.1%. CSIQ +6.2%. STP +3.1%. (First Solar)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM | 2 Comments
  • PEET

    Shares of Peet's (PEET -4.3%) continue to stumble on concerns that the company will miss out on...

    Shares of Peet's (PEET -4.3%) continue to stumble on concerns that the company will miss out on bagged coffee sales as the single-serve market matures. Valuation compared to peers has also raised a few eyebrows, after Green Mountain Coffee Roasters lowered the bar for the sector.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • EBIX

    Insurance software provider Ebix (EBIX +7.4%) jumps after announcing it has signed a contract...

    Insurance software provider Ebix (EBIX +7.4%) jumps after announcing it has signed a contract with an unnamed "U.S. mutual insurance company" to provide its Ebix Advantage cloud software platform. The software will handle policy administration, billing, and other back-end tasks.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • QSR

    Shares of Burger King Worldwide (BKW +1.1%) break higher after Bill Ackman's Pershing Square...

    Shares of Burger King Worldwide (BKW +1.1%) break higher after Bill Ackman's Pershing Square reports in a SEC filing that it holds a 12.0% stake in the newly-public company. For now, Ackman will have answer to majority owner 3G Capital, but that could change in six months when the hedge fund is allowed to sell shares if it desires.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB +4.1%) continues its big rally with the help of Nomura's coverage launch. Some...

    Facebook (FB +4.1%) continues its big rally with the help of Nomura's coverage launch. Some recent news: 1) Facebook has hired Apple's UI design manager to handle its product design. 2) The company's Sponsored Stories ads are now appearing on Zynga.com (NASDAQ:ZNGA). That's possible evidence Facebook wants to create a display ad network, though the company says it won't show ads on other sites at this time. 3) UK regulators are joining the FTC in probing the Instagram deal.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM
  • SNE

    Sony (NYSE:SNE) says it will invest ¥80B ($994M) through March 2014 to increase its image...

    Sony (NYSE:SNE) says it will invest ¥80B ($994M) through March 2014 to increase its image sensor production capacity, in order to address growing smartphone and tablet demand. The investment will be focused on the production of stacked CMOS sensors, which Sony claims offer size and image quality improvements over traditional solutions. Top image sensor rival OmniVision (OVTI -2.6%) appears to be selling off on the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM
  • ARNA

    The selling pressure seen by Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA -16.4%) remains intense, as shares give...

    The selling pressure seen by Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA -16.4%) remains intense, as shares give back a healthy chunk of their recent gains. Possibly hurting Arena's cause is an article from SA's Shane Blackmon, who notes Arena's rally has been fueled by short-covering (22% of the float was shorted as of May 31), and argues "a bear raid seems inevitable" ahead of the FDA's expected June 27 decision on the company's Locaserin weight-loss drug.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM | 28 Comments
  • CAGDF

    Lawmakers in Kyrgyzstan are debating whether to strip Centerra Gold (OTCPK:CAGDF -32.4%) of its...

    Lawmakers in Kyrgyzstan are debating whether to strip Centerra Gold (OTCPK:CAGDF -32.4%) of its license to mine a major gold field in the Central Asian country, with some accusing it of damaging the environment and profiting excessively. The open-pit mine run by Centerra's wholly-owned operator has been the source of a string of toxic spills in past years.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • BHC

    Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX +3.2%) trades higher as the Street comments on an upbeat analyst...

    Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX +3.2%) trades higher as the Street comments on an upbeat analyst day, one that saw the drug developer raise its 2012 guidance to the high end of prior ranges. Jefferies (Buy) declares Valeant to be an "excellent," albeit "controversial" investment, and is impressed with its guidance in light of the company's 20%+ Euro exposure.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • BB

    Though analyst expectations for Research In Motion's (RIMM -1.8%) are generally quite low,...

    Though analyst expectations for Research In Motion's (RIMM -1.8%) are generally quite low, Credit Suisse might take the cake. Analyst Kulbinder Garcha, who rates RIM a Neutral, expects the company to report revenue of $2.68B during next Thursday's FQ1 report, well below a consensus of $3.12B. Moreover, he sees RIM's global smartphone share falling to 4% in 2012 from 11% in 2011, and forecasts hardware losses of $2.5B and $1.9B for FY13 and FY14, respectively.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM | 1 Comment
  • PCXCQ

    Patriot Coal (PCX) -8.1% on news the company will be replaced in the S&P MidCap 400...

    Patriot Coal (PCX) -8.1% on news the company will be replaced in the S&P MidCap 400 index, to be replaced by Alexander & Baldwin (NYSE:ALEX). PCX is currently ranked #400 in the MidCap 400 and is "no longer representative of the midcap market space."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 1 Comment
  • SVU

    Supervalu (SVU +5.5%) stands as the biggest gainer of the S&P MidCap 400 Index with talk about a...

    Supervalu (SVU +5.5%) stands as the biggest gainer of the S&P MidCap 400 Index with talk about a leveraged buyout still percolating. An enticing feature for SVU investors waiting for a LBO is the lush dividend yield of 7.3%, which stands a chance of staying elevated with the company flush with cash.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR +9.7%) continues its recent rally after announcing it has reached a deal with...

    First Solar (FSLR +9.7%) continues its recent rally after announcing it has reached a deal with the Los Angeles Country Department of Public Works over the installation of solar modules at a delayed Antelope Valley project. First Solar says the deal will result in the creation of a 230MW solar plant that will be completed in 2013. First Solar is up 38% from its June 4 low, but is still having an ugly 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • HNR

    Equity investors love Harvest Natural Resources' (HNR +72.7%) sale of its Venezuelan interests...

    Equity investors love Harvest Natural Resources' (HNR +72.7%) sale of its Venezuelan interests to Indonesia's national oil company for $725M. But what's left at HNR? The Venezuelan operation includes 43M boe of proved reserves, but HNR's exploration leases in Indonesia, Gabon, Oman and China haven't produced anything yet. Revenues likely are a long way off.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • LIVE

    Shares of LiveDeal (NASDAQ:LIVE) jump 24.5% higher and are now up over 60% for the week on heavy...

    Shares of LiveDeal (NASDAQ:LIVE) jump 24.5% higher and are now up over 60% for the week on heavy trading volume. While chart watchers say that technical indicators are behind the dramatic action, chatter about a new mobile product is stirring momentum buying as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM | 1 Comment
  • QRVO

    In addition to starting Skyworks with a Buy, Canaccord's Mike Walkley is starting rivals RF...

    In addition to starting Skyworks with a Buy, Canaccord's Mike Walkley is starting rivals RF Micro (RFMD -3.2%) and TriQuint (TQNT +1.9%) at Hold (I, II). Walkley thinks RF Micro's business, hurt by declining sales of Nokia and 2G Chinese phones, is turning a corner on the back of smartphone demand, but he doesn't like the company's valuation. As for TriQuint, he likes its product line and RF filter tech, but thinks higher capacity utilization might not happen until 2014. (yesterday)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • NSC

    Railroad stocks open weak across the board after a price fixing case places the spotlight back...

    Railroad stocks open weak across the board after a price fixing case places the spotlight back on regulation and antitrust issues in the industry. Decliners: NSC -1.2%, CSX -2.6%, KSU -1.8%, UNP -1.3%, GWR -0.8%, CNI -0.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM | 3 Comments
  • ILMN

    Illumina (ILMN +4.1%) and (to a lesser extent) Merck (MRK +1.1%) trade higher after being added...

    Illumina (ILMN +4.1%) and (to a lesser extent) Merck (MRK +1.1%) trade higher after being added to Credit Suisse's U.S. Focus List. Meanwhile, Procter & Gamble (PG +0.7%) isn't showing any ill effects from being removed from the list.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • OLED

    Universal Display (PANL +4.1%) rallies after Deutsche's Vishal Shah starts coverage with a Buy...

    Universal Display (PANL +4.1%) rallies after Deutsche's Vishal Shah starts coverage with a Buy and $45 PT. Shah thinks new licensing deals (LG is singled out), growing OLED adoption in the mobile device and TV markets, the production of blue OLED emitters (a new source of materials revenue), and the OLED lighting market's potential are positive catalysts. It also expects price pressure for PANL's materials to remain low. Goldman defended the company yesterday.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • ARNA

    Frenzied activity continues for Arena Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARNA), now down 8% after dropping...

    Frenzied activity continues for Arena Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARNA), now down 8% after dropping more than 18% in a matter of minutes, a follow-on to its 11% gain on heavy volume yesterday. As the run-up to an FDA decision on its lorcaserin diet drug continues, the company had risen 39% this week before today's open.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM | 21 Comments
  • PACD

    Pacific Drilling (PACD +3.1%) says its ultra-deepwater drillship Pacific Sharav has been awarded...

    Pacific Drilling (PACD +3.1%) says its ultra-deepwater drillship Pacific Sharav has been awarded a five-year contract by Chevron (NYSE:CVX) for operations in the Gulf of Mexico. Estimated maximum contract revenue is $1.07B, bringing PACD's total contract backlog to ~$3.2B.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM | 1 Comment
  • PLX

    Protalix Biotherapeutics (NYSEMKT:PLX) -16.7% premarket after saying European medical...

    Protalix Biotherapeutics (NYSEMKT:PLX) -16.7% premarket after saying European medical authorities have ruled against recommending taliglucerase alfa, an enzyme replacement therapy for treatment of Gaucher disease developed by PLX and its partner Pfizer (NYSE:PFE).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) +3% after Lazard becomes the latest in a string of firms (I, II, III) to...

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) +3% after Lazard becomes the latest in a string of firms (I, II, III) to defend the social gaming giant in recent weeks. Like others, it thinks new Zynga titles such as Ruby Blast and Bubble Safari will drive a pickup in usage. Lazard grants these titles won't generate as much revenue as earlier hits, but also thinks user acquisition costs will be lower, and that Zynga will be able to cross-promote more lucrative titles to their users.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM
  • CCL

    Carnival (NYSE:CCL): FQ2 EPS of $0.20 beats by $0.13. Revenue of $3.5B (-2.2%% Y/Y) misses by...

    Carnival (NYSE:CCL): FQ2 EPS of $0.20 beats by $0.13. Revenue of $3.5B (-2.2%% Y/Y) misses by $50M. Shares +1.8% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM
  • ALXA

    Alexza Pharmaceuticals (ALXA +24%) soaring premarket as it resubmits its application for...

    Alexza Pharmaceuticals (ALXA +24%) soaring premarket as it resubmits its application for Adasuve, a schizophrenic and bipolar disorder treatment. A previous FDA letter suggested a manufacturing deficiency needed to be resolved, but seemed to flag no other concerns for the drug.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM
  • HNR

    Premarket gainers: HNR +82%. ALXA +19%. NPSP +9%. Losers: PLX -12%. R -10%.

    Premarket gainers: HNR +82%. ALXA +19%. NPSP +9%.
    Losers: PLX -12%. R -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 2 Comments
  • NPSP

    NPS Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:NPSP) +8.3% premarket after the company and drug partner Takeda...

    NPS Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:NPSP) +8.3% premarket after the company and drug partner Takeda (OTCPK:TKPHF) say a European panel recommended their Revestive drug receive marketing approval as a once-daily treatment for adults with short bowel syndrome.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 AM
  • RGEN

    Repligen (NASDAQ:RGEN) -20.3% premarket after the FDA confirms the biotech company must conduct...

    Repligen (NASDAQ:RGEN) -20.3% premarket after the FDA confirms the biotech company must conduct further trials before potentially getting approval for its RG1068 synthetic human secretin used to detect pancreatic-duct abnormalities in patients with pancreatitis.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM
  • DRI

    Shares of Darden Restaurants (NYSE:DRI) trade 2.5% lower after missing with its top-line in FQ4...

    Shares of Darden Restaurants (NYSE:DRI) trade 2.5% lower after missing with its top-line in FQ4 and issuing FY13 same-restaurant sales estimates for its three biggest chains a shade below previously announced targets. The company upped its dividend payout to $0.50 a share, bringing DRI's yield up to 3.96%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 AM | 1 Comment
  • DRI

    More on Darden Restaurants' FQ4 (NYSE:DRI): Specialty restaurant group saw 2.7% growth. Longhorn...

    More on Darden Restaurants' FQ4 (NYSE:DRI): Specialty restaurant group saw 2.7% growth. Longhorn Steakhouse sales growth, helped offset declines at Olive Garden and Red Lobster. Plans to open 100-110 new restaurants. For FY13, forecasts total sales will grow 6%-7% and EPS will be 8%-12% higher. Shares -3.8% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:35 AM

  • QE is viewed with the Fed as still having a pretty "high hurdle," St. Louis Fed chief James...

    QE is viewed with the Fed as still having a pretty "high hurdle," St. Louis Fed chief James Bullard tells Bloomberg. Translation: It's going to take more than a 2% market decline for action. See here. The S&P gives up the bulk of its premarket gains, now +0.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:34 AM | 1 Comment
  • MS

    Morgan Stanley (NYSE:MS) +3.4% premarket after it avoids the dreaded 3-notch downgrade from...

    Morgan Stanley (NYSE:MS) +3.4% premarket after it avoids the dreaded 3-notch downgrade from Moody's last night. Just the 2-notch downgrade it received means the bank will face about $3B less (than a 3-notch) in collateral calls from trading partners. From the last 10-Q: "CEO James Gorman has met with the ratings firm more often than usual in the past quarter."

     
     
     
     
    | 7:10 AM | 4 Comments
  • JACK

    Bank of America upgrades Jack in the Box (NASDAQ:JACK) two notches to Buy from Underperform and...

    Bank of America upgrades Jack in the Box (NASDAQ:JACK) two notches to Buy from Underperform and lifts its price target on shares by over 50% to $32. Shares +1.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:51 AM

  • Most of Europe opens lower for much the same reasons that Asia has fallen: Moody's bank ratings...

    Most of Europe opens lower for much the same reasons that Asia has fallen: Moody's bank ratings cuts and concerns about the global economy. London -1%, Paris -0.9%, Frankfurt -1.1% and Milan -0.5%. The outlier is Madrid, which is +0.2%, possibly on relief that its banks apparently need far less than the €100B the EU is offering.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 AM

  • The major Asian markets are uniformly down after a tough day in the U.S., with the Moody's bank...

    The major Asian markets are uniformly down after a tough day in the U.S., with the Moody's bank downgrades, and weak manufacturing data from the U.S., Europe and China seriously sullying the mood. Japan is -0.3%, Hong Kong -1.3%, China -1.4%, and India -1.2%. Still, oil is +0.4% after tumbling in U.S. trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 AM
